components module¶

The purpose of these classes is to collect detailed statistics that are independent of the particular algorithm, and report them in a standardized manner.

class components.Channel(src, dst)¶

Bases: object

Point to point unidirectional Channel

Channels are used to collect network statistics. Each channel count the number of messages and the total message size (in bytes). A channel is defined by the source host, the destination host and the endpoint in which is included.

transmit(msg_size)¶

Adds transmitted msg and its bytes to the channel metrics

Parameters

msg_size – the size of transmitted message

Returns

None

class components.Endpoint(func, req_channel, resp_channel=None)¶

Bases: object

Represents an rpc endpoint

Each rpc endpoint(method) is associated with a request channel, and—if it is not one way—with a response channel.

class components.Host(net, nid)¶

Bases: object

Hosts are used as nodes in the network.

Hosts can be named, for more friendly output. A host can represent a single network destination (site), or a set of network destinations.

Any subclass of host is a single site. For broadcast sites, one has to use host_group.

@see host_group

class components.HostGroup¶

Bases: object

A host group represents a broadcast address.

This is simply an abstract base class. The implementation of this class can be anything. All that this class interface provides is the methods that are required by the communication traffic computation.

join(h)¶

Adds a host in the specific host group

Parameters

h – the host that will join the host group

Returns

NOne

class components.Interface(name)¶

Bases: object

Represents an interface in an rpc protocol.

An interface is like a ‘remote type’. It represents a collection of remote functions that are implemented on a remote host.

add_method(name, one_way)¶

Adds a new method name in the interface and if it is one way or not.

Parameters

  • name – the name of the method

  • one_way – if true there is no response message

Returns

None

class components.MulticastChannel(src, dst: components.HostGroup)¶

Bases: components.Channel

Broadcast unidirectional Channel

A channel can be a multicast channel. This is always associated with some one-way rpc method, sending data from a single source host A to a destination host group B. Again, there are two channels associated with A and B. One channel counts the traffic sent by A, and the second channel counts the traffic received by all the hosts in host group B. For example, if there are 3 hosts in group B, and a message of 100 bytes is sent, one channel will register one additional message and 100 additional bytes, and the other will register 3 additional messages and 300 additional bytes.

transmit(msg_size)¶

Same as Channel.transmit but also calculates the messages that sites received from broadcast.

Parameters

msg_size – the size of transmitted message

Returns

None

class components.Network¶

Bases: object

A collection of hosts and channels.

This class manages the network elements: hosts, groups, channels, rpc endpoints.

Returns

None

  • h – the Host to be added

None

add_interface(ifc, methods)¶

Add an interface to the protocol.

The collection of method should be like: {“method1”: True, “method2”: False}

Parameters

  • ifc – the name of the interface

  • methods – the collection of method names

Returns

None

Add a method into a specific interface.

Parameters

  • m_name – the name of the method

  • one_way – True if the method is one way

class components.Protocol¶

Bases: object

A collection of rpc interfaces.

A protocol is the collection of RPC interfaces used in a network.

Parameters

  • ifc – the name of the interface

  • methods – the collection of methods

Returns

  • name – the name of the method

  • one_way – if true there is no response message

Returns

class components.Proxy(ifc)¶

Bases: object

An rpc proxy represents a proxy object for some host.

When host A wants to call a remote method on host B, it makes the call through an rpc proxy method, so that the network traffic can be accounted for. Host A is the owner of the proxy and host B is the proxied host. Each proxy is associated with an rpc interface, which represents the collection of remote calls (rpc functions) being proxied. In middleware terms, the proxy instantiates the interface.

create_endpoints()¶

Creates the proxy’s endpoints.

If the owner has a proxied host group send will be a collection of remote methods.Also in this case there will be a broadcast so there are not constructed response channels.

Returns

None

class components.Sender(net, nid, ifc)¶

Bases: components.Host

Base class for implementing proxies

To define a proxy on a class, user should define this class as a subclass of Sender class.

connect_proxy(proxied)¶

Connects the proxy given a destination

Parameters

proxied – the host to be proxied

Returns

None

send(method: str, msg)¶

A method which is called from the user when a host sends a msg.

Parameters

  • method – the remote method name the will be called

  • msg – the message that will be sent

Returns

None

class components.StarNetwork(k, site_type=<class 'components.Sender'>, coord_type=<class 'components.Sender'>)¶

Bases: components.Network

Represents a basic star network

Creates a network with k sites and one coordinator and also does the connections.Each site can send message to coordinator and coordinator only broadcasts messages to its sites.

add_coord(ifc)¶

Adds a coordinator to the network.

Parameters

ifc – the name of the interface

Returns

None

add_sites(k, ifc)¶

Adds k sites to the network.

Parameters

  • k – the number of sites

  • ifc – the interface the sites’s proxies are associated with

Returns

None

setup_connections()¶

Set up all the connections between the sites and the coordinator.

Returns

None

components.remote_class(ifc)¶

A decorator for hosts who are supposed to have remote methods

Parameters

ifc – the name of the interface the class’s remote methods belong to

Returns

None
